website_summaries.verdict: Great looks mixed with a semi-open design delivers higher sound quality than the price would suggest.
pros: We love how the semi-open back of each can creates better range and dynamics in the music delivery
cons: Sound leakage is more prominent at higher volumes

customer_reviews.title: Compared to older set - uncomfortable for me.
customer_reviews.text: I used older K240s for 40 years (analog - silver color highlights, like the current K240 MKII) and never stopped loving them - (even had to replace the small elastic height tensioners on the sides, in 2014). Those were destroyed in a fire early this year, so I replaced them with the current (gold highlighted) K240s. I find the sound to be excellent, same as my originals - yet - they are SO tight on my head I do not like using them. Sorry to say I'm considering returning them for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Awful design. Didn't even get to test the sound.
customer_reviews.text: They literally ripped chunks of my hair out any time I put them on or took them off. Clearly AKG doesn't have any women working at their product testing offices because I can't imagine anyone with long hair letting that go unnoticed. Absolutely unbelievable lack of thought given to the design of this model.
customer_reviews.author: N. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: This model is made in China.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality was surprisingly dulled. Sound is attenuated (rolls off) around 3000Hz, making an almost muffled listening experience. Bass is low understandably as these are open ended headphones. Equipment used 1. Samsung S9, volume at around 75% 2. Focusrite Scarlett 18i20 ar around 60% Boy do I miss my old Sonys from the 90's (made in Japan). Build quality on these AKGs are REALLY flimsy. So bad I cant even consider AKGs higher models.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: just dont
customer_reviews.text: if you like quality louad music with some bass this is not for you, my earbuds are louder than this, very sloppy fit, huge but sound is barely existent, huge disappointment. dont buy it ohhh, there is 0 bass and i mean it, nada
customer_reviews.author: Darien

customer_reviews.title: Pros: Price, Audio Quality, Comfort // Cons: Noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for noise-canceling headphones, there are better options. That said, the audio quality is excellent. I use these while editing video, animating, recording audio, and taking online courses and I couldn't be happier. You'd be hard-pressed to find a more comfortable set of headphones, too. Neither a pro, nor a con: the cord is super long. Sometimes that's helpful, other times it takes some management. Overall, though, I recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: AD Sterling

customer_reviews.title: AKG wins my ears
customer_reviews.text: I can't wear any sort of headphones for too long. It's not only that they hurt my ears, but all of my headphones and earbuds are noise cancelling, and I get uncomfortable quickly due to my sensitive hearing. These headphones block off just the right amount of noise. For personal use, these are definitely desktop headphones. FANTASTIC for long gaming and music sessions. My first day using them, after 4 hours with them on I forgot I was still using headphones. You're getting way better audio quality than you're paying for, although is by no means incredible. Expect noise pollution as well. These are precisely what I was looking for, and then some. Get you some.
customer_reviews.author: Malygaro

customer_reviews.title: An excellent lightweight headphone at a budget price
customer_reviews.text: I love the nice flat response of these headphones. If one uses headphone with heavy base for recording studio use ("sounded great at the time"), how do you think your final mix will sound? It will sound thin and lifeless. Yes, these aren't truly, spare no expense, professional quality headphones. But for serious amateurs or people working towards a professional career, I think these are a good choice. And best of all, they are simply great for listing to music; including listening to your analog vinyl collection (if you have one).
customer_reviews.author: Boregonian 21

customer_reviews.title: Great value Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for something to listen to my vinyl albums on that isn't a closed can bluetooth or noise cancelling headphone. I didn't want to spend a couple of hundred dollars either, so decided to try these. These have a nice sound and as others note are not bass heavy which is fine with me. They are very comfortable to wear for long periods (and look cool also). These arrived on time and packaged well for transit. For reference these are hooked up to a Marantz PM5005 integrate amp with a 15 foot 3.5mm extension hooked to the headphones so I can move around the room.
customer_reviews.author: FrankS

customer_reviews.title: Great home studio headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I've used a lot of headphones in studios over the years and these are great for when you're at the helm of your own home studio. Nice flat response so you can hear the entire mix. I've worn them for hours without discomfort. I could hear the results in my mixes immediately. Good quality construction, especially considering the price point! As far as bass response....these are open back headphones with a flat response. If you're looking for bass response, you're in the wrong aisle. But if you're looking for quality budget headphone monitors, you're done. Get these!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I don't understand the good review on the sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased from Amazon.com so I don't think it is a counterfeit, but it sounds very muddy and does not provide the sound quality I expected in this price range. I broke this headphone in for over 20 hours, but the sound did not change much. Spend a bit more money and get SHP-9500. The quality of sound differs drastically. SHP-9500 is much much better. This headphone should be priced at $35, then the price make sense. SHP-9500 sounds ~$100. I own multiple headphones and ~$3000 sound system for home theater/music. Do NOT get this headphone expecting $60 priced sound.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: NOT ENOUGH BASS for music production.. otherwise accurate sounding
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. These don't have enough bass to use for producing music with. The bass is very flat, you can tell when you change out into just about any other kind of headphone/earbud. The rest of the spectrum is pretty accurate and awesome for gaming/watching Netflix. Unfortunately I have to buy another set of headphones now, so don't make my mistake if you are producer type.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: IF you want to tune out nosie... move along.
customer_reviews.text: They sound more like they are semi to full open for me... IDK. The comfort is great except my ears are bigger than normal so they have to be sort of tucked in. The wire plug detaches from the headset which is cool...but why. no technical terms hear for all they readers :) One feature I dislike is the elastic strings that keep it snug against the head. If you look at the third picture... they are connected from the end of the leather head strap to the logo at the middle of the ear area. behind the two black wires that go over the head.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Using these in my studio now!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a 15 year old pair of Sony headphones, whose pads were finally disintegrating. They allow more external sound in, which is good. I was worried that they would allow enough sound out to be picked up by mics when you're recording, but that hasn't been a problem. I think they sound great, and while they're not the highest end headphones you can buy, they're a great product at a great price, and I don't have to worry about them being knocked around in the studio. I will buy another pair to replace some AKGs here pretty soon.
customer_reviews.author: P. Strickler

customer_reviews.title: Fairly comfortable with glasses, good sound, mostly solid construction
customer_reviews.text: These are really excellent headphones. I was looking for a pair that were reasonably priced, but also comfortable with my glasses. They really work well for long multi-hour sessions and I use them daily. I often have to find *just* the right position for them to remain comfortable for more than like 10 minutes but once hey are good I'm usually all set. The construction is pretty solid, though the ear pads themselves are a tad flimsy. I have only had them for a few months and the threading is already coming undone. I'm planning on getting softer pads, hoping to make them a bit easier to find a comfortable position and have them last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Aisha

customer_reviews.title: Good for hearing your surroundings without sacrificing audio quality
customer_reviews.text: These have been my daily computer headphones since I bought them, I wear them for 5+ hours at a time without exhaustion. They sit light and comfortable on the head, never had pinching/pressure point problems with them. Being able to replace the cable is a big bonus for me (and others with cable-hungry housepets) Only two big complaints. I have long hair and the sliding portions of the band for size adjustment will snag me on a weekly basis. Lastly, more noise bleeds out of the headphones than you may expect; it's very noticeable from my generally weak/cheap desktop microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Rhea V

customer_reviews.title: Great look. Bad sound. HUGE disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace my Sony MDR - 7506's which were falling apart from my overheated whisper room/vocal booth. They look like they might sound good. Unfortunately, the volume is so low and sound has no bass presence whatsoever. Very flat sounding - as if engineered to have double low shelf/bass roll off. I have to crank the monitor volume during voice over recordings, causing me to hear everything else in and outside which is distracting. Was expecting more from these. Annoyingly, they don't really fasten onto your head (as mentioned in the listing) which isn't great either.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Rosselli

customer_reviews.title: OK, but I found other AKG phones to be better...
customer_reviews.text: These AKG 240K Studio open-back phones are generally highly rated as an industry standard, and I found they probably deserve this. But I personally didn't much like the size and fit of their ear pads, finding them just a bit too small and uncomfortable. (Especially when I also wear them with my in-ear hearing aids.) I did try replacing the pads with Brainwavz ones, but the regular size Brainwavz pads don't fit the 240k at all well and they actually have a bit smaller inside opening than the original pads. I now mostly use the lower rated (less expensive) AKG 275 closed-back phones with their larger pads replaced with even larger opening XL Brainwavz pads.
customer_reviews.author: Greywoulf

customer_reviews.title: flimsy outer construction
customer_reviews.text: casing on the outer part of the right headphone speaker fell apart after a few months of regular use. not meant for long-term or heavy use, i guess. waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: paulsaab

customer_reviews.title: Good for Solo Rehearsal and General Listening
customer_reviews.text: Open back headphones are better for practicing singing than most closed back. The reason is twofold: lighter weight and more ambient sound inclusion. The latter is a two-way street so they’re also not the best for recording vocals. I like having both types. That being said, I’ll say they’re not as accurate as my DT-770 for critical listening. Of course, they’re also cheaper. Get these if you want decent general listening headphones that are light weight but don’t need lots of sonic isolation.
customer_reviews.author: Hexspa

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality, being able to hear almost every instrument.
customer_reviews.text: I use these headphones when plugging in my guitar to the amp and listening to music or audio on my phone & laptop and I am BLOWN AWAY at the clarity they produce, I can also wear them for hours and they do not hurt my ears. They are also self-adjusting, meaning that when you put them on, they expand to the size that is comfortable for you. These are excellent for listening to music or audio, but you are still able to somewhat hear people next to you, in case they need your attention for the moment, but I cannot hear distractions from probably 6' and more away.
customer_reviews.author: DM BOND

customer_reviews.title: Iffy
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for use on air and for mixing. Six months after purchasing, one is now dead as a doornail. The left side went within the first three months, then three months later, the right. The other headphone seems to be holding up but I'd be lying if I said I'm not expecting it to die soon. They sound good but I cannot recommend these headphones based on my personal experience, and I wont be spending money to get the other fixed, (If it can be fixed), since it may be cheaper buying a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Demetrius Christian

customer_reviews.title: Quality is great and they are comfortable for hours
customer_reviews.text: PROS: -Sound quality is awesome -comfortable to wear for hours -super long cable CONS: -bass could be a LITTLE more bumpin' -i really really wish they were a LITTLE louder I mostly use them for making music (ableton), and listening to music/youtube. Couldn't be better for the latter, but when im designing my bass components in ableton i can hear the bass tones but dont feel them at all. I also find myself turning the volume all the way up sometimes to hear certain things better. Overall, great buy for less than $100, but if you can just save up a little more then get the super nice ones.
customer_reviews.author: Sanj

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: I have an electric drum set. My cats broke my skull candy headphones (yeah I know) so I needed a new (cheaper) pair. I have a small head but these are great and I don’t see why they wouldn’t fit comfortably on a larger (probably normal sized) head. Sounds great, feels great, can’t hear most outside noises, and most importantly doesn’t hurt my ears or give a headache after playing for awhile. And believe me I have the volume all the way up while drumming to music. Would I use them to casually listen to music? No. But that’s bc the cord is really long (great for the drums) and I do like a bit more bass for those purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Pro headphones at an excellent price!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned these headphone for all of 4 hours now & listened to a variety of musical styles & I'm floored – they sound incredible. I also own Bose QC3 (which are noise cancelling), and the AKG K240 gives an overall clearer & crisper sound image. The tone is great! They are not advertised as noise cancelling so I wouldn't categorize them in that way, but the design covers over your full ear which in itself helps to isolate background noise. I bought these specifically for mixing my own music which I have yet to do with them, but from my first test of listening, I'm really happy with this purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Dark, distant, ok performers
customer_reviews.text: They didn't have a crisp high end like I was hoping for. Listening to cymbals I realized that they just wouldn't work for me. They sound good but I have Grado 80s and the 240s just don't do anything better than the American made Grados. I have the basic Audio Technica 20s and I prefer them over these 240s also. I think they really lack in the high end. The bass is just ok, they have a veiled sound to my ears. I remember enjoying these in a guitar store and now Im thinking that it could of been the older version.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: tip for sound-proofing; note for long-haired users
customer_reviews.text: these open headphones sound beautiful for a wide variety of music, and they don't clamp / compress my skull or jaw in an uncomfortable way even after long wear. tip: to cheaply sound-proof / noise-cancel, listen with high-fidelity earplugs in (and turn the volume up). note: if you have 'long' hair (mine is shoulder-length), it may get pinched between the back of the "K240 studio" button and the gold rim. gotta be careful when you take them off.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Chen

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP & POOR SOUND QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: Cheap & too lightweight. Poor sound quality. Definitely NOT worth $60 bucks. There are plenty of other manufacturers out there they make them a lot better. Hate to leave negative reviews but buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Loveleigh

customer_reviews.title: These sound awful.
customer_reviews.text: I had AKG's back in the day and they were great. This pair sounds awful. The audio is thin, muffled, and almost distorted. I won't use them anymore. I tried twice, and I just...cant. Get something else!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've always liked AKG headphones & I bought these as a Christmas present for my significant other. We're both senior citizens & our hearing sucks, so we watch TV using headphones so conversations are easier to understand. His hearing is much worse than mine so these are perfect for him & he's stated he's pleased with them. I've tried them & they're fine for TV but personally, I wouldn't use them to listen to music as I prefer a more refined sound.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable headphones
customer_reviews.text: For the price its worth, this would be a great choice to have for a semi-open back headphones. The material they used for the earmuffs are not as comfortable as I thought it would be. I had to order a different padding; Brainwavz pads to replace them which was a bit tugged but it fits nicely. The quality is quite decent, without a dac/amp it is hard to hear with it on a PC; still overall would choose this again if I had to order another cheap pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Nikku808

customer_reviews.title: OK, I have tons of headphones, and these just don't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I compared these to a bunch of other headphones, mostly bluetooth, Sony's Bose, Palnatronics, Evens, B&W's, Marshalls, Sennheisers, Ghostek, etc, and I didn't hear any difference in sound quality to keep them. Maybe bluetooth has improved enough these days to make lower end open back headphones obsolete? Or maybe my old ears just can't hear the things younger people can. I'm 47. I love music, and listen to a wide range of it, but honestly, just didn't do it for me..
customer_reviews.author: J.C. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Worth Trying.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality so far. I use them for watching TV. I like the large soft pads around the ear part and the leather strap that sits on top of the head. The over ear headphones became very uncomfortable and hurt after a while. No issue with these over the ear ones. For what I use them for, the sound is fine. I like the longer cord too. I can still hear outside noises which is what I wanted so I didn't rate that. I didn't rate bass because I didn't care about that but it's fine for what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones but bad padding
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with this headphone. It works and sounds great. My only grip is the padding, it's very firm so it ends up irritating my ears in a short use. However, I'll see if I can replace them with better padding and it would do wonders
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Wear them as ear muffs
customer_reviews.text: Okay the sound quality was fine. On the other hand they are heavy and when they covered my ears it felt like someone turned on the heater. The item is well made just not comfortable to me.
customer_reviews.author: Diana L Lenik

customer_reviews.title: Decent headphones but...
customer_reviews.text: The wire is of the cheapest kind. It is the ultra thin type that kinks up no matter how hard you try to straighten out by winding it around the phones themselves. This wire just kinks up into knots all over the length of its surface.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Dees

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for mixing audio tracks!
customer_reviews.text: The dynamic frequency range for these headphones are stellar. Other headphones may have 40mm drivers or larger, but these headphones have a better balance of frequency representation. I used these to mix a simple audio track and every other sound source I play the track on sounds properly mixed. My previous headphones were imbalanced and listening on other devices would make me want to remix and remix to get it right.
customer_reviews.author: R. Peterman

customer_reviews.title: My favorite headphones for Learning songs & critical listening
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional musician. I also am a music educator. I frequently need to learn songs by ear for students, and performance. These headphones are great for critical listening. They are reasonable priced. In my experience they work with notebook computers, mobile devices without needing a separate headphone amp. The open back design also makes them great for zoom calls.
customer_reviews.author: None77

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones, but They Catch Hair VERY Easily
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are great overall. Clear audio on all fronts, nothing over-emphasized (until you EQ with a bass booster) and they're accurate for gaming. The only real issue that I have is that, almost every time I wear them, they catch and break/pull out some hair. I have fairly long hair (Down to the small of my back) and losing some every time I put on headphones is extraordinarily irritating. If you have long hair and like to take care of it, I'd recommend looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Thornerie

customer_reviews.title: Good price for good sound
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality and sound out of the box. The mids are a little too high and muddy without equalization, and the highs could serve to be a bit higher; otherwise generally flat response with alright bass for being semi-open cans. Only serious complaint is the proprietary cable being somewhat annoying to detach and reattach, but it connects solidly and has no jiggle. I recommend these over the Superlux HD668's if you're looking for a round over-ear semi-open headset, as these not only fit better but feel more solidly built while the HD668's have noticable give and groaning in its frame. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Adequate sound and accurate
customer_reviews.text: My wife first used it on a karaoke system. The karaoke system already has small room reverb and echo built in. Microphone used was bluebird condenser and she was astonished by how good it sounded with a lot of volume and accurate sound. Although that's not what I've been hearing coming out of the speakers lol! I also used this on the Fender acoustasonic 15, (plugged concert guitar / MXR M300 Reverb) and (Blue Bird mic / TC Helicon Mic Mechanic 2) pedal I get excellent sound with a little tweaking. 4 stars being a workhorse studio phones, higher priced earphones are better if not best. But this is adequate for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: StickyMsgs

customer_reviews.title: Needs an amp to be truly good, beautiful sound.
customer_reviews.text: The headphones barely have any opening. I actually like them. I have fairly large ears and prefer fully covered headphones. Very balanced, neutral sound by default. If you prefer bass boosted headphones, your EQ can be adjusted to pump out nice thumpy beats. Very clear, clean tones. If you use these with a phone, you *will* need an amp, as the sound is too quiet, even at max volume, on a oneplus 6t. With the right hi-fi player and source files, you'll get an amazing sound, one that you will appreciate from a mobile device.
customer_reviews.author: phoenixrises

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad about this headphone set
customer_reviews.text: The good and bad about AKG K240 studio headphones: The quality of the sound to detail is what I was looking for. We are doing a lot of recording. This headphone gave the crisp detail we were looking for. The other thing that we liked was the comfort fitting while wearing it. Compared to the other head sets, this did not bring discomfort after working for a while. The volume in this headset is low. We had to crank the volume up a lot to do post editing with the AKG. But for us, this was not a deal breaker, what it lacks in volume, it compensated for in quality.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headphones
customer_reviews.text: These have to be the most comfortable headphones I have ever used. The sound is amazing and crystal clear. I am used to gaming headphones and after 10 minutes with these, I will never use gaming headphones again. Totally awesome product!!!
customer_reviews.author: DannyR

customer_reviews.title: Wanted studio quality phones to add to my collection and the price and reviews were right
customer_reviews.text: Nice headphones but definitely great headphones when paired with a decent headphone amp. I paired mine with a FiiO A3 and it’s like a brand new set. You can really hear all the ranges and for my taste, the bass is just right. Also tried the A3 with my Sennheiser 4.50 BTNC phones in the direct cable to iPad mode and the sound was outstanding. These headphones are highly recommended for serious music aficionados as well as audiophiles paired with a decent amp.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Palumbo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for digital piano
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these with my digital keyboard. One thing I didn't want was TOO much isolation and lack of sound stage. These accomplish exactly what I need for a fantastic price. It feels like you're playing in a room rather than in your head and provides just enough bass in the low tones as to accompany the higher tones rather than make them disappear.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Scheer

customer_reviews.title: Good soundstage but hollow sounding.
customer_reviews.text: The AKG K240STUDIO headphones have a good soundstage but sound hollow. I used the Schiit Fulla 2 headphone amp to drive these and while it made a difference in the quality of the sound, these headphones still lacked mids and enough bass. I wouldnt recommend them. They are very light weigt. Some people like this. To me this made them feel cheap in comparison to a headphone with more weight like the Hifiman 400s.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, but not bass heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding sound quality! I'll definitely buy more of them! Buyer beware: These are NOT bass heavy. These are great for serious music listeners who want a consistent balance of frequencies. If you want bass heavy, go buy something else, like those made by Beats. <rolls eyes> They fit very nicely; I could wear them all day. The cord does detach, but make sure you are careful to plug it in one way; DON'T FORCE IT if it doesn't go in right away. I am using this for work in both live and studio recordings.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S.

customer_reviews.title: Got these to compare to my k7xx
customer_reviews.text: They hold up really well. I replaced the stock pleather cuffs with an 8 dollar pair of velour pads from cosmos and these are much more comfortable now. Super light and relatively balanced with an emphasis on bass. That emphasis is good considering how open these are. They say semi-open but the soundstage is wider than any of my Grado's and the sound leakage is similar. Great for general listening (especially metal/rock/edm/acoustics) and gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Audionerd

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Those are great headphones for the price! Excellent sound, very comfortable with realistic sound - they don't have that artificially boosted bass like for example sony mdr-xb950 or beat headphones, but the sound is clear, acoustic and real. They also look very solid and quality built. I don't know how long they are going to last because I got them few days ago. I will definitely recommend them and probably buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my boyfriend to use as a gaming headset. He absolutely loves it. The fact they are open back is nice as well since we game in the same room and he can hear my when I speak to him. Definite plus!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Maurine

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the sound
customer_reviews.text: These were semi-open headphoines, so they did not promise any noise cancellation. Frequency response seemed true enough for the price, with adequate, but not emphasized, bass. The only fault I find is the leather ear cups are quite warm, thus a bit uncomfortable wiuth extended use. I use them for mixing at my DAW, which can be for prolonged sessions. I also would have preferred a 1/4" phone plug, rather than having to use an adapter (included with te headphones , but that is a minor point.
customer_reviews.author: PhineasT

customer_reviews.title: I Bought Two!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones at the time of purchase were $40 dollars. They were like $160 way back when! These are amazing headphones to rehearse, perform, and studio monitoring. They are great for mixing a band when studio monitors cannot be turned on. I highly recommend for the audiophile and audio engineer!
customer_reviews.author: Dan A.

customer_reviews.title: beautiful design
customer_reviews.text: the name & the great design were hard to ignore. although one side went out after using a short time I would feel confident in buying again. in todays fast paced assembly errors are going to happen occasionally & should not be used to criticize the product. when positive reviews average out to over 80 % you are doing something right.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford I.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, pretty good fit
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints with the sound of these K240 Studio headphones. They're efficient enough, not too peaky, not too bright or boomy. What I might change if I could would be the comfort factor. They are better than some, but not as comfy as I had hoped. Still, it's hard to compete with their performance in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable quality
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound good and feel really comfortable, even after wearing them awhile. They are semi-open, which is great for mixing, but not so good for tracking. We tried to use them for tracking (listening to one track while recording another) and some sound came through into the new track we recorded.
customer_reviews.author: Mark N

customer_reviews.title: Great for Vocals
customer_reviews.text: These are really good for recording vocals because they have a nice mix of bass treble and midrange, but more importantly have a semi open back so what you hear is pretty similar to the habit of using one earphone to listen to yourself sing. In other words you hear a mix of effects and live sound, so you can get a better sense of how you are recording. Noise cancelling headphones, on the other hand don't do this and make it harder to sing in key.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Doe

customer_reviews.title: Sound clarity wasn't what i'm used to.
customer_reviews.text: It could be because I'm used to gaming headphones... but I found the clarity and overall sound quality lacking. I would say it's not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: irislich

customer_reviews.title: The Price is Crazy
customer_reviews.text: These headphone are simply amazing. I am so crazy about them. I have been using them to listen to movies and music on my laptop and I get completely immersed in what is playing. The sounds are all well defined and crystal clear. AKG is one of the best brands out there and these don't disappoint. I am not even concerned that these are under $100 and not $500-$1000 headphones. These sound far better than the price they are sold at. At the price these are you aren't going to find a better set of headphones, period.
customer_reviews.author: F. Sasso

customer_reviews.title: It is a real legend on the field and on the world stage!
customer_reviews.text: - This is my second AKG. The first AKG is a Bluetooth one. - I am not a pro but I really see the big difference. - It is a real legend on the field and on the world stage. - The overall quality is absolute number #1. - I am going to order a second same one for myself - one for the living room and another for the basement. - I knew AKG from Samsung Note9 weeks ago and I am going to stay with AKG forever before I die. - Highly recommended. - 10 stars!
customer_reviews.author: BELL

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best, do not sound like studio phones
customer_reviews.text: Bass quality suffered and was flat and crunchy like a speakerphone speaker, entire thing sounds like $20 non-studio headphones. Feel really cheap and not like what I was expecting when I bought them. Headphones in the same price range can do much better on low sounds and retain quality above 50% volume (these really just don't.) They feel cheesy in your hands and on your head compared to how pics look.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S. Ft Lauderdale

customer_reviews.title: Love these.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using sony MDR-7506 headphones for years and bought several pairs, but the connecting wire in the headphone over time would get damaged and fail, leaving me with headphones that cant easily be fixed. These AKG's definitely don't provide the noise cancellation that you will find with many headphones but the comfort and quality will exceed many others. I also love that I can replace the cord, as the default is quite long.
customer_reviews.author: joseph cook

customer_reviews.title: Sound great but don't last..
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through 3 sets of these in the past 5 years of just casual use. It's always the same problem.. The left can quits working. I bought my most recent pair in July 2018 and by December 2018 it had quit working. When researching the problem online I discovered that it happens quite often with this particular model. For the price you pay you should expect these to last a LOT longer. I'm giving 2 stars instead of just 1 because while they don't last very long they do sound pretty good and are quite comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: MV

customer_reviews.title: Not what everyone else got..
customer_reviews.text: I can hear more outside noise than what was coming from the heaphones. I'm so dissapointed because it looks as though everyone else received a good set. Maybe I just got a faulty set, idk. But I chose AKG because they're the best brand I've had experience with.
customer_reviews.author: Kianna

customer_reviews.title: They were working fine til today
customer_reviews.text: I got this in June to use for listening back to my voice recordings for VO, I never spent this much on headphones, I put them on today Sept 1st and it's dead in the Right Ear! They worked great til now and it hasn't been that long since I got them, I'm extremely upset. Edit: Got in contact with the company and they approved to exchange it.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Miles

customer_reviews.title: Great and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great and comfortable. The bigger ear cushion openings allow for longer and more comfortable wearing. True, like others have said, the cord is very long, but I just bind it together and put it in my pocket. I don't travel far with the headphones so that is fine. I've been using ear-buds for around six straight years, and I like the fact that these headphones give a little more open sound. The overall sound is great. The bass is not over-powering, and the highs are nice and crisp. I didn't want to spend much more than the price for these ($58).
customer_reviews.author: James R.

customer_reviews.title: Great performance for open air headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect headphones if like me you need to be able to hear you surroundings or find complete audio environment isolation uncomfortable. Sound quality is as high except for a small loss of low end which can be evened out with EQ. It is important to know that the advantages of an open design are great with few significant disadvantages and these headphones are a perfect economical solution to a perrenial audio monitoring issue.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Graves

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a comfortable home theater headphones to replace Grado SR-60. It's fine so far. Sound quality seems good and much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: Decent alternative headphones
customer_reviews.text: I got these on the recommendation that they are bassier than the other headphones this person owned (Audio Technica M50x, which I also purchased, and another pair that I don't own). While I don't think I wasted my money - since most studio musicians will tell you it's best to check your mix on multiple different sources - they aren't ideal for being your only pair of headphones. They probably are ”bassier” than other headphones, if not for the fact that there's almost no high end coming out of them. Still, I think they're a good, cheap second/etc. option to add to your arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: Jasper

customer_reviews.title: My go to mastering headphone. I love them.
customer_reviews.text: I've used the K240s from the beginning. The original sounds a little better than the Chinese version, but it's not bad enough to stop buying them anymore. They really shine with older music but hold up with new tunes. If you are looking for headphones with tons of bass, these are NOT the ones. If you are looking for a pair of flat reference headphones that you can listen to for hours without listener fatigue, THESE ARE THE ONES! They're super comfortable too!!! I love these headphones!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the Quality, Replace the Earpads, Almost no Noise Cancellation
customer_reviews.text: Love these cans, great for practice. Saying that, the donuts for earpads aren't ~that~ great and I'd recommend to purchase other over-ear earpads. The only other complaint is that the noise cancellation is rather poor, so make sure you have a quieter environment.
customer_reviews.author: S Morgan Hunt

customer_reviews.title: These have been around a long time for a reason...
customer_reviews.text: These things are perfect for my podcast studio and offer a balanced sound during live recording. They offer just the right amount of highs, mids, and lows. These are a staple and have been around for decades. Highly recommended, especially for the low price.
customer_reviews.author: Billy D

customer_reviews.title: These are worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: --Comfortable --The weight is light (in a good way) --The build quality is great. The only metal parts are the gold around the cup and the bands. The plastic feels like it's high quality. --Great sound --Great price --Replaceable wire Cons: --A bit tricky to take somewhere, but these headphones are more for home use. I mean I don't take my surround system with me either xD Other notes: Some reviews said that they would bleed too much sound, these are semi-open headphones, that is normal! It is not a con!
customer_reviews.author: Andreas P.

customer_reviews.title: Best price for a great quality of headphones.
customer_reviews.text: It’s the best of the best in audiophiles headphones clarity in every note of the song I tested. Love it it’s comfort no ears fatigue. It’s made for audiophiles it not you regular headphones they are semi open back you can hear everything around you. Nice price for the quality of this headphone and I recommend for editing songs.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Angel Castro Colon

customer_reviews.title: It's okay for the price...
customer_reviews.text: I had made this purchase quickly due to my old AKG's breaking in two. I've always love being able to swap out damaged cables..so I went back to AKG. However, its been years since my last purchase and this model lacks in quality that other AKGs provide. At its price...it does the job. But the audio quality & product material feel cheap..and it is. I'll continue to support AKG but not at a lower price point.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Too tight sound?
customer_reviews.text: A nice tight sound; maybe a little too tight for my taste. I admit that I was expecting more low bass due to the semi-open design as opposed to a pair of open design headphones I use. I also thought they sounded a bit sterile, not fully accurately reproducing instruments. For the money I think they are very good; just not quite what I am looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Jimme

customer_reviews.title: Not my first pair of AKG 240s
customer_reviews.text: These cans are comfortable and sound good for studio recording purposes. I use them for Zoom meetings and audio narration. This is my second pair. My first pair lasted well over a decade, and I still have them, though I did replace the earcups at least once, and the foam covering the speakers a couple of times. But what do you expect after more than ten years?
customer_reviews.author: Michael Heister

customer_reviews.title: It is a fine headphone
customer_reviews.text: For this price it is definitely one of the Best Buy. The sound is warm and musical. I am not any expert but to me the mid range is warm, full but it gets little muddy. They need to be more open, airy or you say transparent . Certain high note seems dimmed down too much. Again like most of the close or semi close back headphone, the singer or instrument sounds like they are playing at 6” above your head. There is lack of space and stage. But if I am that picky I need to buy those $600 headphone right? True. So don’t overly expect but you definitely get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: A good buy now that prices are slashed to make room for version 2.
customer_reviews.text: When it was time for my niece and nephew to get their first "decent" headphones this was my choice. Version 2 is now out, which means the originals are available with deep price cuts. These are clear, balanced and comfortable. They use them for listening to music and for playing electronic keyboards. I worried that she would be disappointed that they are not Beats headphones. She got to try a friends set of Beats and decided that the AKG's sound much better. ... I'm so proud. She really can hear the difference.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: you want these, not some other
customer_reviews.text: well, they don't cancel a lot of noise, but they aren't designed to. but, they are designed to be one of the best sounding and fitting over-ear headphones. and they are. this is German engineering sounding good, not some rap singer licensing his name
customer_reviews.author: bob-bob-bob

customer_reviews.title: If you have long hair it will get stuck and ripped out every time.
customer_reviews.text: Low bass , not for mixing , the cable is cheap , if you have long hair it will get caught and ripped out every single time , hum when turned up and I don't fit well .
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: You could do a lot worse. But after hearing these talked up so much, I was disappointed. They hurt my ears after only a few minutes. And the sweat is real. How are you supposed to use these in the studio for hours? Each person is different (my head is on the large side), but I had high hopes. Sound quality is good, pretty flat from what I can tell. Maybe a little light on the low end and a little high on the mid-low end. Definitely not as pleasurable as my JBL active monitors. But there are times I can't use those.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer_Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very good headphones
customer_reviews.text: I really like these headphones for the fact that they're semi-open back. In my house i can still hear the things around me as well as the video/game i am playing with exquisite quality. The bass it a little lack luster but the mids and highs are where these headphones truly excel. Listening to music is a joy, the panning in games or movies is stunning. The adjustability is not the greatest, if you have a small head it gets a little uncomfortable to wear long periods of time. Overall, these are underpriced in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Better than Beats, great quality
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these headphones. They sound amazing. If you're like me (and I know I am) and you have a big head, finding headphones that don't push down on your ears are hard. These go over the head and are very comfortable. They sound better than Beats or any earbuds I've found. The cons are the cord is really lon and there is no way to take calls. These are both because these are studio headphones I believe. If you're looking for incredibly high quality sound for the price, go for these.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Not overpriced!
customer_reviews.text: I'm no audiophile, but man.. these sound awesome! Attached a Mod-mic to this thing and you got a gaming headset for around $100, and it blows away the competitors by far! I only wish they made one of those Bluetooth attachment accessories to make this wireless if you wanted them to be. The audio cord is really long, great for a connection far away, a clutter if it's not tied up though. Also, a choice in ear pads would be nice, I dont like leather on my ears, but not a reason to knock a star off. Great headphones!
customer_reviews.author: Leangel

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to do audio editing, but the music I listen to with these is so rich. It is the best quality headphones I have ever owned, and also the cheapest! I would 100% buy these again over Bose or Beats headphones. It doesn't have bluetooth though...so probably the only downside if you wanted to use them walking around. Also! The headphone cord is ridiculously long, so you could probably easily use them for gaming or watching TV.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Comfort was key
customer_reviews.text: I got these to plug into a Vox amplug 2 (the blues one) and they work perfectly. I have a big head (hat size 7 3/4) so it's often hard to find headphones that actually cover my ears. These do. I can hear the guitar strings through the headphones when I have the volume low, and I haven't plugged them into an amp yet, but they do the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Spolsky

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable headphones I've ever worn.
customer_reviews.text: I hate wearing headphones. I would always use earphones because I hated how headphones would sit on my head and cut off circulation in my temples. These, however, automatically adjust to your head and don't press down hard at all. Easily the most comfortable headphones I've ever worn, have great quality, and a detachable cable (that way you don't have to replace the entire thing if your cable gets messed up). Highly recommend, even if you're on a budget!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy Garthwaite

customer_reviews.title: These are garbage
customer_reviews.text: The only good thing with these are the adjustable headband to make the weight seem less than your typical headphones. Sound quality is garbage Zero bass Cheap build quality If you want something similar but better quality: go with Audio Technica's or Sennheisers.
customer_reviews.author: GamerTech

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: These are some great sounding headphones for the price. The build quality isn't that great, but the sound quality is spot on and that's what I needed. Very balanced and clean. Style wise, they leave a bit to be desired and they're rather large. I still recommend these for mixing/mastering or just listening to music.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Quality Headphones
customer_reviews.text: The sound of these headphones with a laptop is not good and rather tinny and flat. When listening on my desktop, however, the sound was excellent. I would highly recommend these headphones for any serious listener, as I am one.
customer_reviews.author: John Areiter

customer_reviews.title: Clearly high quality.
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable to wear and work well over my hearing aids. Sometimes the open back allows outdoor sounds through, but I’m not in an enclosed studio so I expected this. It’s not usually any problem. I’m very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: JohnA

customer_reviews.title: Studio Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these studio grade headphones to replace my Beatz by Dre headphones. These headphones are actually a better quality as the lining on the over ear piece does not peal off, solid head harness and quality sound. Good deal for the price, was recommended by another producer to me.
customer_reviews.author: Shareef Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Open ear design
customer_reviews.text: I use these headphones to monitor my HF HAM radio. They work very well at all the frequencies that I listen to and allow mw to monitor my transmissions as well..That is when the open ear design comes into play by allowing external sounds to be heard. . They sound great when listening to music too.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Sklar

customer_reviews.title: Neutral headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great neutral headphones. I use these just as a daily music listener. Don’t enjoy how they don’t get loud enough for my taste but quality is great. You can use an amp and get some great volume out of it. Very comfortable and light. Forget I have them on at times. Nice semi open sound stage. I’m not a huge sound enthusiast so don’t have much to compare it to but I feel like the best way to sum these up is they’re good neutral headphones, not bass heavy and clear at mid and high, for mixing and recording because slight eq settings will be noticeable
customer_reviews.author: David Robles

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for gaming, and audio work
customer_reviews.text: I got these to replace a pare of audiotechnicas i had gotten for the same purpose. I do a bit of audio work and a lot of gaming, and i will tell you... the lows on these aren't overpowering, but they are there and clear. Everything else is the same way, just an awesome pare of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: The Grim Panda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent flat sounding headphones
customer_reviews.text: Excellent flat sounding headphones. The bass is within the mids so all you bass thumping enthusiast won't want these in your mitts. (With that out of the way) sound stage is just enough away to feel the instruments in different areas. Highs are just at the point where you think it's going to eat your inner ear drum but then slopes perfectly off for a great pitch. Mids are great where vocals and accompanying sound are flat and neutral. The price for this headset is phenomenal ! You definitely get a lot more from these cans then what you pay for !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: AKG K240 STUDIO HEADPHONES
customer_reviews.text: I bought the same model set (Made in Austria) about 30 years ago and these sound, feel and seem just as sturdy as my other set. (Still working and used daily) These are quite flat and add very little coloring to the audio spectrum. I use them as my "check the mix" for comparison to my studio monitors and other sound sources.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Extremely uncomfortable and cheaply built.
customer_reviews.text: The gold decals on the sides of the headphones were peeling off when I took them out of the box, but I was willing to ignore that, until I tried them on. I have never worn headphones as uncomfortable as these. Couldn't even focus on how they sounded they felt so terrible on my head. Would slide up the side of my head pulling my earlobes up and just did not fit correctly at all. Had to return them right away.
customer_reviews.author: crazyeyes98

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable headphones ever.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not exactly a connoisseur of headphones, but I've tried a wide range of them and had access to some of the go-to's via my brother. These are far and away the most comfortable headphones I've ever tried. They fit my large head effortlessly and stay that way for hours. On a smaller head they might shake loose with quick head movements as some have claimed, but on me they stay put. As far as sound...I am a bit of a speaker buff and these are good enough that I seemed to forget I am using them and not my bookshelf units.
customer_reviews.author: R. M. Swain

customer_reviews.title: Feels like the audio is in the room
customer_reviews.text: You know I’ve had headphones more expensive then these but for some reason I enjoy the way these sound the best. Last year looking for headphones at guitar center these where there and asking the people who work there any recommendations the guy shunned these although I liked what I heard I ultimately choose another. Well now I bought these and they sound really great and I’ve have open back headphones more expensive then these but the AKG sounds just right
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Cruz

product_meta.title: AKG Pro Audio K240 STUDIO Over-Ear, Semi-Open, Professional Studio Headphones
product_meta.description:
Size:K240STUDIOAKG K240 Studio Headphones feature a classic design that has become a standard in monitoring. This newer, lower impedance, 55-ohm version provides remarkably higher volume level when used with portable studios, keyboards, drum machines and other project studio gear. It's a professional level of performance for the home studio. Features include an integrated semi-open air design with a highly accurate dynamic transducer for naturally open sound quality, and circumaural (around-the-ear) pads for hours of wearing comfort. Frequency range: 15 Hz to 25,000 Hz. Stereo (1/8-inch minijack and 1/4-inch) connections. AKG K240 Studio Features: Low, 55 Ohm impedance, plug-in cable, Self-adjusting headband for optimum fit, Single cable for ease of use, Semi-open, circumaural design. AKG'S MOST POPULAR PROFESSIONAL HEADPHONE. A classic design which has become a standard in monitoring. Now with Varimotion XXL capsule for studio sound at home and for portable use. The 'integrated semi-open air' design incorporates a highly accurate dynamic transducer, and an acoustically tuned venting structure behind the element produces a naturally open sound quality. The circumaural (around-the-ear) pads are designed for hours of wearing comfort, while the steel-cable, self-adjusting headband construction and single-sided professional quality audio interconnect ensure extended reliability in demanding professional studio applications. Proven, popular, excellent - New, improved and even better. Made in China. The item includes the OFC screw type cable.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


The AKG K 240 Studio is an update of the "classic" AKG K 240 Monitor. The new K 240 Studio delivers even wider dynamic range and higher sensitivity than its well-known and widely-used predecessor. The secret to the semi-open K 240 Studio's sound quality is the new XXL transducers in acoustically tuned vented enclosures with circumaural (around the ear) pads. The circumaural pads envelope your ears nicely and reward you with smooth, solid bass and well-balanced, articulate mids and highs.

Founded in Vienna, Austria in 1947, AKG has built a legendary reputation in the professional audio industry for products that perform flawlessly. The reputation of AKG and its celebrated quality are built on more than 55 years of experience, incredible design, meticulous craftsmanship and a clear understanding of what truly sounds right. AKG introduced the K 140 in 1974 and the K 240 Monitor in 1975, which became the most widely used headphones in recording studios and broadcast facilities worldwide. Generations of musicians and audio engineers use these AKG products to create great mixes, hit songs and albums cherished by millions around the world. The new AKG Professional Studio headphones carry on the tradition of these audio tools and are a sound investment that will pay handsome returns with years of flawless sonic performance for professional recording engineers and demanding users of high quality home or portable audio equipment.

Delivers solid bass and well-balanced mids and highs XXL TRANSDUCERS WITH VARIMOTION DIAPHRAGM
The new XXL transducers use AKG's patented Varimotion diaphragm to ensure extremely accurate response at any listening level. This technology creates a diaphragm that is thinner, more elastic toward the outside edges for more powerful bass response and thicker, less resonant in the center for pure, accurate mids and clear, detailed highs. The large size of the transducers makes the overall sound more life-like and three-dimensional to capture the emotional and sonic content of your soundtracks.

GIMBAL-TYPE SUSPENSION
To ensure your listening comfort, AKG Professional Studio headphones utilize a self-adjusting headband with a flexible steel structure to deliver optimum fit for your headphones without any fiddling. The structure is flexible, yet strong enough to allow bending for single ear use and is durable enough to withstand rough handling. A gimbal-type suspension ensures the earcups of all AKG Professional Studio models will conform to the shape and size of your ears without pressing on them for hours of fatigue-free, comfortable listening.

WEAR THEM AS YOU LIKE
Rugged construction, a non-twisting headband, and powerful sound allow you to use your headphones on a single ear only or wear them in any other way you may prefer. AKG Professional Studio headphones are ideal for DJ and live sound use because they are durable enough to withstand the roughest kind of handling during transport or on stage.

DETACHABLE CABLE WITH MINI XLR CONNECTOR
The new AKG Professional Studio headphones utilize a detachable input cable for easy replacement if ever necessary. The cable and headphones use mini XLR connectors for perfect contact and secure mechanical connection. The cable is made of 99.99% oxygen-free copper and has gold plated plugs on both ends including the screw-on 1/8" to 1/4" stereo jack adapter for maximum signal transfer.

PERFECT FOR PORTABLE AUDIO
You need good quality audio for all your listening--including computer, minidisc, portable CD or DAT player--as well as in the studio. Owing to their high sensitivity and wide dynamic range, the AKG Professional Series headphones are efficient enough to be used with these lower level output sources and still deliver the high definition sound you need when working in the studio or on stage. The excellent workmanship AKG headphones are known for and high quality components ensure loss-free transmission and reproduction of high-resolution signals from all types of digital audio sources.
feature_bullets: Audio Interface type: Stereo plug – 3.5mm (1/8-inch) with 6.3 mm (1/4”) screw-on adapter

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,770 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #156 in Over-Ear Headphones#377 in Earbud & In-Ear Headphones
